title: Educating national security leaders on artificial intelligence
summary: MIT has developed a three-day custom program called "Artificial Intelligence for National Security Leaders" (AI4NSL) to educate military and government leaders on the basics of AI, machine learning, and data science as they relate to national security. The program aims to help leaders understand the benefits and potential negative consequences of AI, as well as how to navigate organizational challenges. The course covers technical topics in AI and also emphasizes organizational planning and implementation. The program promotes collaboration and networking among participants and faculty from MIT's School of Engineering, MIT Stephen A. Schwarzman College of Computing, and MIT Sloan Executive Education. The curriculum will be updated to address new developments in AI and national security.
